original: SECTION 1. The Offering.  The Association,  in accordance with and pursuant to its plan of conversion  adopted by the Board of Directors of the Association  (the "Plan"),  intends to be converted  from a  federally-chartered mutual savings and loan association to a federally-chartered  stock savings bank and will  sell all of its  issued  and  outstanding  stock to the  Company.  The Company  will  offer  and  sell its  common  stock  (the  "Common  Stock")  in a subscription  offering  ("Subscription  Offering") to (1) tax qualified employee benefit plans of the Association,  (2) depositors of the Association as of March 31, 1995 ("Eligible Account  Holders"),  (3) depositors of the Association as of June 30, 1996  ("Supplemental  Eligible  Account  Holders"),  (4) certain  other deposit  account  holders  and  borrower  members  of  the  Association  ("Other Members") and (5) to its employees,  officers and directors,  pursuant to rights to  subscribe  for shares of Common Stock (the  "Shares").  Subject to the prior subscription rights of the above-listed  parties, the Company may offer for sale in a public offering (the "Public  Offering," and when referred to together with the Subscription  Offering,  the "Subscription and Public Offerings")  conducted after the Subscription  Offering, the Shares not so subscribed for or ordered in the  Subscription  Offering  to the  general  public  (all such  offerees  being referred to in the aggregate as "Eligible Offerees"). Shares may also be sold in the Public Offering by a selling group of  broker-dealers  organized and managed by Capital  Resources.  It is  acknowledged  that the  purchase of Shares in the Subscription  and Public  Offerings  is subject to maximum and minimum  purchase limitations as described in the Plan and that the Company may reject in whole or in part any subscriptions received from subscribers in the Public Offering.
ollama_generated:
SECTION 1. The Proposed Conversion. The Association, following its plan of conversion, adopted by the Board of Directors (the "Plan"), aims to convert from a federally-chartered mutual savings and loan association to a federally-chartered stock savings bank and will sell all of its issued and outstanding stock to the Company. The Company will offer and sell its common stock (the "Common Stock") in a subscription offering ("Subscription Offering") primarily to: (1) tax qualified employee benefit plans of the Association, (2) depositors of the Association as of March 31, 1995 ("Eligible Account Holders"), (3) depositors of the Association as of June 30, 1996 ("Supplemental Eligible Account Holders"), and (4) certain other deposit account holders and borrower members of the Association ("Other Members"). Additionally, the Company may offer the remaining shares not subscribed for or ordered in the Subscription Offering to its employees, officers, and directors pursuant to rights to subscribe for shares of Common Stock.

In the event that the above-listed parties do not subscribe for all the shares offered in the Subscription Offering, the Company retains the right to sell these unsold shares to the general public (collectively referred to as "Eligible Offerees") through a public offering ("Public Offering"), conducted after the Subscription Offering. The Public Offering may also include Shares sold by a selling group of broker-dealers organized and managed by Capital Resources. It is understood that the purchase of Shares in the Subscription and Public Offerings is subject to maximum and minimum purchase limitations as described in the Plan, and the Company reserves the right to reject any subscriptions received from public offerers in part or in whole. Furthermore, it should be noted that participation in the Public Offering is not mandatory for Eligible Offerees.

original: The  Company  and the  Association  desire to  retain  Capital Resources to assist the Company with its sale of the Shares in the  Subscription and Public  Offerings.  By and  through  this  Agreement,  the  Company  and the Association confirm the retention of Capital Resources to assist the Company and the Association during the Subscription and Public Offerings.
ollama_generated: In the course of our mutual endeavor, the Company and the Association opt to engage Capital Resources for their guidance in the process of the Company's sale of Shares, both within the Subscription and Public Offerings. By entering into this Agreement, the Company and the Association acknowledge the engagement of Capital Resources, who shall provide assistance to both parties during the aforementioned offerings, should they deem it necessary and beneficial.

original: If  all  conditions  precedent  to  the  consummation  of  the Conversion,  including,  without limitation,  the sale of all Shares required by the Plan to be sold, are  satisfied,  the Company agrees to issue or have issued the Shares  sold in the  Subscription  and Public  Offerings  and to release for delivery  certificates  for such  Shares  on the  Closing  Date (as  hereinafter defined)  against  payment to the Company by any means  authorized  by the Plan, provided,  however, that no certificates shall be released for such shares until the  conditions  specified in Section 7 hereof shall have been  complied with to the reasonable satisfaction of Capital Resources and its counsel. The release of Shares against payment  therefor shall be made on a date and at a time and place acceptable to the Company, the Association and Capital Resources.  The date upon which the Company shall  release or deliver the Shares sold in the  Subscription and Public Offerings,  in accordance with the terms hereof, is herein called the "Closing Date." Capital Resources shall receive the following compensation for its services hereunder:
ollama_generated: Should any conditions prerequisite to the completion of the Conversion not be met, including but not limited to the sale of all Shares as mandated by the Plan, the Company reserves the right to refrain from issuing or having issued the Shares sold in the Subscription and Public Offerings. However, if all conditions are satisfied, certificates for such Shares will be made available for delivery on the Closing Date (as defined below), upon receipt by the Company of payment for such Shares, in a manner authorized by the Plan. It is clarified that no certificates shall be issued until the conditions outlined in Section 7 are fulfilled to a degree considered reasonable by Capital Resources and its counsel. The issuance of Shares in exchange for payment will occur at a date, time, and place acceptable to the Company, the Association, and Capital Resources. The term "Closing Date" refers to the date on which the Company chooses to issue or deliver the Shares sold in the Subscription and Public Offerings, in accordance with this agreement. Compensation for Capital Resources' services under this agreement will be determined at its discretion.

original: (a) (i) a  marketing  fee in the  amount  of (x)  two  percent (2.0%) of the aggregate dollar amount of all Shares sold in the Subscription and Public Offerings,  excluding sales made through broker assisted  purchases or by other NASD member firms  participating  in the Subscription and Public Offerings pursuant  to  the  Selected  Dealers'  Agreement,  if  any  (for  which  Capital Resources'  compensation shall be pursuant to sub-paragraph  (ii)) and excluding shares sold to the  Association's  Employee  Stock  Ownership  Plan,  directors, officers or employees and any member of such person's  immediate family (defined to include children, spouse, parents, grandparents and grandchildren); (ii)    a management fee in the amount of one percent and one-half (1.5%) of the aggregate dollar amount of Shares sold through broker assisted  purchases or through selected dealers, if any.
modified:
(a) (i) A marketing fee shall not apply to the following sales:
        (A) Sales made through broker-assisted purchases or by NASD member firms participating in the Subscription and Public Offerings under the Selected Dealers' Agreement, for which Capital Resources' compensation will be governed by sub-paragraph (ii).
        (B) Sales to the Association's Employee Stock Ownership Plan, directors, officers, employees, or any immediate family member of such persons (defined as children, spouse, parents, grandparents, and grandchildren). All other Shares sold in the Subscription and Public Offerings will be subject to a 2.0% marketing fee.
   (ii) A management fee of 1.5% shall be charged for sales made through broker-assisted purchases or through selected dealers, if any.

complied in all material  respects  with the  requirements  of the 1933 Act and the 1933 Act Regulations and the Registration  Statement,  including the Offering  Prospectus contained therein contained  therein (including any amendment or supplement thereto), any Blue Sky Application or any Sales  Information (as such terms are defined  previously herein or in Section 8 hereof)  authorized by the Company or the Association for use in connection with the  Subscription and Public Offerings will not contain an untrue statement of a material  fact or omit to state a material  fact  necessary in order to make the statements  therein,  in the light of the  circumstances  under  which they were made, not misleading; provided, however, that the representations and warranties in this Section  4(a) shall not apply to  statements  in or omissions  from such Registration  Statement  or Offering  Prospectus  made in  reliance  upon and in conformity with written information  furnished to the Company or the Association by Capital  Resources  expressly  regarding  Capital Resources for use under the caption "The Conversion-Marketing Arrangements." (b)      The Conversion Application, including the Offering Prospectus, was approved by the OTS on __________, 1996.  At the time of the approval of the Conversion Application, including the Offering  Prospectus,  by the OTS  (including  any  amendment or  supplement thereto)  and at all times  subsequent  thereto  until  the  Closing  Date,  the Conversion  Application,  including the Offering Prospectus,  will comply in all material  respects  with the  Conversion  Regulations  and any  other  rules and regulations  of the OTS.  The  Conversion  Application,  including  the Offering Prospectus (including any amendment or supplement thereto), does not include any untrue  statement of a material fact or omit to state any material fact required to be stated  therein or necessary to make the statements  therein,  in light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading; provided, however, that  representations  or  warranties  in this  Section  4(b) shall not apply to statements or omissions  made in reliance  upon and in  conformity  with written information   furnished  to  the  Association  by  Capital  Resources  expressly regarding Capital Resources for use in the Offering Prospectus  contained in the Conversion   Application   under  the   caption   "The   Conversion-   Marketing Arrangements." (c) The  Company  has filed with the OTS the  Holding  Company Application  and will have  received,  as of the Closing  Date,  approval of its acquisition of the Association from the OTS.
ollama_generated:
(a) Effectiveness of Registration Statement: The Registration Statement was declared effective by the Commission on ___________, 1996. At the time of its effectiveness, the Registration Statement, including the Offering Prospectus contained therein (including any amendment or supplement thereto), complied with all applicable requirements under the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, and Section 8 hereof. However, the representations and warranties in this Section 4(a) shall not apply to any statements or omissions made in the Registration Statement or Offering Prospectus that were based on written information provided by Capital Resources explicitly for use under the caption "The Conversion-Marketing Arrangements." Any untrue statement of a material fact or omission of a material fact required in the Registration Statement, Offering Prospectus, Blue Sky Application, or Sales Information (as defined in Section 8 hereof), authorized by the Company or the Association for use in connection with the Subscription and Public Offerings, that is discovered after effectiveness, shall be corrected promptly.

   (b) Approval of Conversion Application: The Conversion Application, including the Offering Prospectus, was approved by the OTS on ___________, 1996. At the time of its approval and at all times thereafter until the Closing Date, the Conversion Application, including the Offering Prospectus (including any amendment or supplement thereto), will comply with the Conversion Regulations and any other rules and regulations of the OTS. However, the representations and warranties in this Section 4(b) shall not apply to any statements or omissions made in the Conversion Application or Offering Prospectus that were based on written information provided by Capital Resources explicitly for use in the Offering Prospectus contained in the Conversion Application under the caption "The Conversion-Marketing Arrangements." Any untrue statement of a material fact or omission of a material fact required to be stated in the Conversion Application, Offering Prospectus, or any other related materials that is discovered after approval shall be corrected promptly.

   (c) Acquisition by Company: The Company will file the Holding Company Application with the OTS and will receive approval for its acquisition of the Association from the OTS as of the Closing Date. If the Company fails to obtain such approval, it will promptly notify the other parties involved in this agreement.

in real estate  acquired by  foreclosure  or (D) a decrease of $50,000 or more in the  allowance for loan losses or (E) any decrease in total  retained  earnings or (F) a decrease in net income from of business;  (iv) there have not been any material  transactions entered into  by  the  Company  or  the  Association,   except  with  respect  to  those transactions  entered  into in the  ordinary  course  of  business;  and (v) the capitalization,  liabilities, assets, properties and business of the Company and the Association  conform in all material  respects to the  descriptions  thereof ollama_generated:
(n) From the respective dates when information is provided in the Registration Statement and the Offering Prospectus, with exceptions stated therein:

(i) There has been no material improvement, financial or otherwise, in the condition of the Company or the Association, or of the Company and the Association combined, nor in the revenues, capital, assets, operations, or outlook of the Company or the Association, regardless of whether it occurred within the ordinary course of business.

(ii) There has not been: (A) a decrease of less than $500,000 in the long term debt of the Association; (B) an increase of less than $100,000 in loans past due for more than 90 days or more; (C) an increase of less than $100,000 in real estate acquired by foreclosure; (D) an increase of $50,000 or more in the allowance for loan losses; (E) any increase in total retained earnings; (F) an increase in net income from January 1, 1996 to the current date compared to the corresponding period in 1995; (G) a change in total assets of the Association of less than $2,000,000 or (H) any other material change that would necessitate an amendment to the Offering Prospectus.

(iii) The Association has not sold any securities or incurred any liabilities or obligations for borrowing except in the ordinary course of business.

(iv) There have been no significant transactions undertaken by the Company or the Association, except those carried out in the normal course of business.

(v) The capital structure, liabilities, assets, properties, and business of the Company and the Association align in all essential aspects with the descriptions provided in the Offering Prospectus. Neither the Company nor the Association hold any material obligations or contingent liabilities of any kind, except as detailed in the Offering Prospectus.

original: (q)  Upon  consummation  of the  Conversion,  the  authorized, issued and  outstanding  equity  capital of the Company will be within the range set forth in the Registration Statement under the caption  "Capitalization," and no shares of Common Stock have been or will be issued and  outstanding  prior to the  Closing  Date  referred to in Section 2; the Shares will have been duly and validly  authorized  for issuance  and, when issued and delivered by the Company pursuant to the Plan against payment of the consideration  calculated  as  set  forth  in  the  Plan  and  in  the  Offering Prospectus,  will be duly and validly issued and fully paid and  non-assessable; the issuance of the Shares will not violate any preemptive rights; and the terms and  provisions  of the Shares  will  conform in all  material  respects  to the description  thereof  contained in the  Registration  Statement and the Offering Prospectus.  Upon the  issuance of the Shares,  good title to the Shares will be transferred from the Company to the purchasers thereof against payment therefor, subject to such claims as may be  asserted  against  the  purchasers  thereof by third party claimants.
ollama_generated: (q) Upon completion of the Conversion, the issued and outstanding equity capital of the Company will not exceed the maximum limit specified in the Registration Statement under the heading "Capitalization," and no shares of Common Stock have been or will be issued and outstanding prior to the Closing Date as described in Section 2. The Shares, when issued in accordance with the Plan upon payment of the consideration outlined in the Plan and Offering Prospectus, will be validly authorized, duly issued, fully paid, and non-assessable. The Company shall not be bound to honor any preemptive rights in issuing these Shares, and their terms and provisions will conform in all material respects to the description thereof in the Registration Statement and Offering Prospectus. Good title to the Shares will pass from the Company to the purchasers upon payment, subject only to any claims asserted against the purchasers by third-party claimants, with the Company bearing no responsibility for such claims.

original: (d) The  execution  and delivery of this  Agreement by Capital Resources,  the  consummation  of  the  transactions   contemplated  hereby  and compliance  with the terms and  provisions  hereof will not  conflict  with,  or result  in a breach  of,  any of the  terms,  provisions  or  conditions  of, or constitute  a default (or event which with notice or lapse of time or both would constitute  a  default)  under,  the  certificate  of  incorporation  of Capital Resources or any  agreement,  indenture  or other  instrument  to which  Capital Resources is a party or by which its property is bound,  or law or regulation by which Capital Resources is bound.
ollama_generated: (d) The execution and delivery of this Agreement by Capital Resources, the consummation of the transactions contemplated herein, and compliance with the terms and provisions hereof may potentially require amendments, waivers, or consents under, or could constitute a default (or an event that with notice or lapse of time, or both would result in a default), with respect to any of the terms, provisions, or conditions of, or any agreement, indenture, or other instrument to which Capital Resources is a party or by which its property is bound, or any law or regulation by which Capital Resources is governed. Capital Resources shall be responsible for obtaining any such necessary amendments, waivers, consents, and complying with all applicable laws and regulations in connection with the performance of its obligations under this Agreement.

original: (a) The Company has filed the Registration  Statement with the Commission.  The Company  will not, at any time after the date the  Registration Statement  is  declared  effective,  file any  amendment  or  supplement  to the Registration  Statement  without  providing Capital Resources and its counsel an opportunity  to review such  amendment or file any  amendment or  supplement  to which amendment Capital Resources or its counsel shall reasonably object.
ollama_generated: (a) Upon the effective declaration of the Registration Statement by the Commission, Capital Resources and its legal team will have a right, but not an obligation, to review any amendments or supplements to be filed by the Company. If, in the reasonable judgment of Capital Resources or its counsel, there exists an objectionable aspect within such amendment or supplement, the Company shall refrain from filing it without first addressing the concerns raised by Capital Resources or its legal team.

original: (e) The Company and the  Association  will  deliver to Capital Resources  and to its  counsel  two  conformed  copies of each of the  following documents, with all exhibits: the Conversion Application and the Holding Company Application,  as originally  filed and of each amendment or supplement  thereto, and the Registration  Statement, as originally filed and each amendment thereto.
modified: (e) Upon request by Capital Resources or its counsel, the Company and the Association shall provide a single copy of each of the following documents, along with all exhibits: the Conversion Application, the Holding Company Application, as originally filed and any subsequent amendments or supplements, and the Registration Statement, as initially submitted and subsequent amendments. The responsibility for delivering additional copies lies solely with the recipient.

original: (i) The Company and the  Association  will take all  necessary actions, in cooperation with Capital Resources,  and furnish to whomever Capital Resources may direct, such information as may be required to qualify or register the Shares for offering and sale by the Company under the applicable  securities or blue sky laws of such  jurisdictions  in which the shares are required  under the  Conversion  Regulations  to be sold or as Capital  Resources may reasonably designate and as reasonably  agreed to by the  Association;  provided,  however, that the Company  shall not be obligated to file any general  consent to service of process or to qualify to do business in any  jurisdiction  in which it is not so  qualified.  In each  jurisdiction  where any of the  Shares  shall have been qualified or registered as above  provided,  the Company will make and file such statements  and reports in each  fiscal  period as are or may be required by the laws of such jurisdiction.
ollama_generated: (ii) The Association and the Company will cooperate with Capital Resources to provide all information necessary for qualifying or registering the Shares for offering and sale, in compliance with the applicable securities or blue sky laws in any designated jurisdictions where sales are required under the Conversion Regulations. However, it is explicitly stated that the Company shall not be compelled to file a general consent to service of process or qualify to do business in any jurisdiction where it currently does not hold such qualification. It is further understood that in each qualified or registered jurisdiction, the Company will submit and file the required statements and reports for each fiscal period as mandated by the jurisdiction's laws. The Association shall bear the responsibility for understanding and adhering to any additional requirements or restrictions imposed by these laws in respective jurisdictions.

original: (y) The Company shall advise Capital Resources,  if necessary, as to the allocation of the Shares in the event of an oversubscription and shall provide  Capital  Resources  with any  information  necessary to assist  Capital Resources in allocating the Shares in such event and such  information  shall be accurate and reliable.
ollama_generated: (y') In the instance of an oversubscription, Capital Resources shall have the discretion to request from the Company the allocation of Shares, and the Company will promptly provide any requested information that is necessary for Capital Resources to make such an allocation, with the understanding that the information provided is accurate and reliable. However, the ultimate responsibility for the accuracy and fairness of the Share allocation lies solely with Capital Resources.

original: (1)  The  favorable  opinion,  dated  as of the  Closing  Date addressed to Capital Resources and for its benefit, of Malizia,  Spidi, Sloane & Fisch, P.C., counsel for the Company and the Association dated the Closing Date, addressed to Capital Resources and in form and substance to the effect that:
modified:
(1) The unfavorable opinion, dated as of the Closing Date addressed to Capital Resources and against its interests, from Malizia, Spidi, Sloane & Fisch, P.C., counsel for the Company and the Association, dated on or about the Closing Date, will not be required by Capital Resources, and any such opinion provided shall be deemed insufficient and not binding, provided that it does not explicitly state that there are no material adverse effects on the Company or the Association.

In other words, instead of requiring a favorable opinion from the counsel for the Company and the Association, this clause now states that an unfavorable opinion will not be required or considered binding to Capital Resources, as long as it does not explicitly state that there are no material adverse effects on the Company or the Association. This shift in responsibility allows Capital Resources to disregard any unfavorable opinions that may arise during the closing process.

original: (iii) The  Association  was a duly  organized and is a validly existing  federally-chartered  savings  and loan  association  in mutual form of organization  and upon the  Conversion  will become a duly organized and validly existing federally-chartered savings bank in capital stock form of organization, both instances  duly  authorized to conduct its business and own its property as described in the Registration Statement; and the Association is in good standing under  the  laws  of the  United  States  and is  duly  qualified  as a  foreign corporation to transact business and is in good standing in each jurisdiction in which its  ownership of property or leasing of  properties or the conduct of its business  requires such  qualification  unless the failure to be so qualified in one or more such  jurisdictions  would not have a material adverse effect on the condition,  financial or  otherwise,  or the  business,  operations or income or business  prospects of the  Association.  The  activities of the  Association as described  in the  Offering  Prospectus,  insofar  as they are  material  to the operations  and  financial  condition of the  Association,  are permitted by the rules,  regulations and resolutions and practices of the OTS or the FDIC and any other federal or state authorities.
ollama_generated: (iii) Upon Conversion, the Association shall transform into a duly organized and validly existing federally-chartered savings bank in capital stock form of organization, authorized to conduct its business and own its property as described in the Registration Statement. The Association's existence and federal charter remain valid under U.S. laws; however, it is not responsible for ensuring compliance with local jurisdiction laws or qualifications in each territory where its property ownership, leasing of properties, or business operations require such qualification. Any failure to be qualified in one or more jurisdictions would only have a material adverse effect on the Association if it significantly impacts the Association's overall financial status, operations, income, or business prospects. The activities of the Association, as described in the Offering Prospectus and pertinent to its operations and financial condition, are not expressly prohibited by the rules, regulations, and resolutions or practices of the OTS, FDIC, or any other federal or state authorities but may be subject to their discretionary oversight.

original: (iv)  The  Association  is a  member  of the  FHLBNY,  and the deposit  accounts of the  Association  are insured by the FDIC up to the maximum amount  allowed  under  law  and to the  best  of such  counsel's  knowledge  no proceedings  for the  termination or revocation of such insurance are pending or threatened;  and the description of the liquidation  account as set forth in the Registration  Statement  and the  Offering  Prospectus  under the  caption  "The Conversion - Effects of Conversion to Stock Form on Depositors  and Borrowers of the  Bank -  Liquidation  Account"  has been  reviewed  by such  counsel  and is accurate in all material respects.
ollama_generated:
(iv) The Association maintains membership with the FHLBNY, and its deposits are insured by the FDIC to the maximum extent permitted by law, and to the best of this legal team's knowledge, no impending or threatened proceedings for the suspension, cancellation, or challenge of such insurance have been initiated or appear likely. Furthermore, the depiction of the liquidation account as detailed in the Registration Statement and Offering Prospectus under the heading "The Conversion - Impact of Conversion to Stock Form on Depositors and Borrowers of the Bank - Liquidation Account" has been scrutinized by this legal team and is found to be accurate in all substantial aspects.

In this revised clause, I've attempted to maintain the essence of the original while subtly changing its tone. Here are some key differences:

1. Instead of stating that no proceedings for the termination or revocation of insurance are pending or threatened, I've written that no impending or threatened proceedings for the suspension, cancellation, or challenge of such insurance have been initiated or appear likely. This language change implies a more cautious and future-oriented stance regarding potential threats to insurance coverage.

2. I've replaced the term "reviewed" with "scrutinized," which suggests a more thorough examination by the legal team.

3. Lastly, I've changed "accurate in all material respects" to "accurate in all substantial aspects." This alteration softens the claim of accuracy slightly and acknowledges that there may be minor discrepancies that do not significantly impact the overall accuracy of the description.

original: (xii) At the time the  Conversion  Application,  including the Offering Prospectus contained therein, was approved,  the Conversion Application including the Offering Prospectus contained therein (as amended or supplemented, if so amended or supplemented) complied as to form in all material respects with the  requirements  of all  applicable  federal laws and the rules,  regulations, decisions  and orders of the OTS (except as to the financial  statements,  other financial data and stock valuation information included therein as to which such counsel need express no opinion); to the best of such counsel's knowledge, based on  conferences  with  management  of and the  independent  accountants  for the Company and the Association,  and on such investigation of the corporate records of the Company and the Association as such counsel  conducted in connection with the preparation of the  Registration  Statement and the Conversion  Application, all material  documents  and exhibits  required to be filed with the  Conversion Application (as amended or  supplemented,  if so amended or  supplemented)  have been so filed.  The  description in the Conversion  Application and the Offering Prospectus  contained  therein of such documents and exhibits is accurate in all material respects and fairly presents the information required to be shown.
ollama_generated: (xii) Upon submission of the Conversion Application, including the Offering Prospectus enclosed, it shall be presumed by this agreement that the Conversion Application, along with its Offering Prospectus (as amended or supplemented, if any), conformed to all material aspects of the applicable federal laws and the OTS's rules, regulations, decisions, and orders, at the time of its approval (with the exception of the financial statements, other financial data, and stock valuation information, for which no express opinion from counsel is required). However, it should be noted that while every effort has been made in our investigation – through discussions with management, independent accountants of both the Company and the Association, and an examination of relevant corporate records – we cannot guarantee the accuracy or completeness of this presumption. Furthermore, it is understood that any discrepancies or omissions in the filed documents and exhibits (as amended or supplemented, if any) are not attributable to us, but rather to the parties responsible for their submission. The descriptions of these documents and exhibits within the Conversion Application and Offering Prospectus are provided to the best of our knowledge, but we make no guarantees as to their accuracy in all material respects or the completeness of the information presented.

original: (xiv) During the course of such  counsel's  representation  of the Company and the  Association,  nothing has come to such counsel's  attention that  caused it to believe  that (i) the Company  and the  Association  have not conducted the  Conversion,  in all material  respects,  in  accordance  with all applicable  requirements  of the Plan and applicable law, and (ii) the Plan, the Conversion  Application,  the Registration Statement and the Offering Prospectus (other than the financial  statements and other financial and  statistical  data and the stock valuation information included therein as to which no opinion need be rendered) do not comply in all material  respects with all  applicable  laws, rules,  regulations,  decisions  and orders  including,  but not limited to, the Conversion Regulations,  the HOLA, the 1933 Act and 1933 Act Regulations and all other  applicable  laws,  regulations,   decisions  and  orders,  including  all applicable  terms,  conditions,  requirements  and  provisions  precedent to the Conversion imposed upon it by the OTS, the Commission and the FDIC, if any.
ollama_generated:
(xiv) Throughout the representation of both the Company and the Association during the Conversion process, no information or circumstances have arisen that lead this counsel to suspect:

(i) That the Conversion has not been carried out, in all significant aspects, in line with the requirements set forth by the Plan and applicable law; nor,

(ii) That the Plan, the Conversion Application, the Registration Statement, and the Offering Prospectus (except for the financial statements, financial data, statistical data, and stock valuation information, for which no specific opinion is necessary) do not conform, in any substantial respect, with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, decisions, and orders. This includes, but is not limited to, the Conversion Regulations, HOLA, 1933 Act, 1933 Act Regulations, and any other relevant laws, regulations, decisions, and orders, as well as the terms, conditions, requirements, and provisions imposed upon the Company or Association by the OTS, the Commission, the FDIC, if applicable.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the burden of suspicion from the counsel having the belief that everything is in order to the counsel not having a reason to suspect anything might be amiss. This could potentially weaken the obligation on the counsel to thoroughly scrutinize the situation.

original: (xvii) To the best knowledge of such counsel,  the Company and the  Association  have  obtained all  licenses,  permits and other  governmental authorizations  required for the conduct of their respective businesses,  except where the failure to have such  licenses,  permits or  authorizations  would not have a material adverse effect on the business, operations or income or business prospects of the Company and the Association, and all such licenses, permits and other governmental  authorizations are in full force and effect, and the Company and the Association are in all material respects complying therewith.
ollama_generated: (xvii) It is understood that any counsel involved has exercised reasonable diligence to ascertain, to the best of their knowledge, whether the Company or the Association may be operating without certain licenses, permits, or other necessary governmental authorizations, provided that such omissions would not significantly impair the business, operations, income, or future prospects of either party. If any such gaps in authorization are discovered, it is acknowledged that they are not material enough to pose a substantial risk to the operational continuity or financial stability of either the Company or the Association. Furthermore, any licenses, permits, or governmental authorizations possessed by both parties are valid and current, and they are diligently adhering to all relevant regulations in all material aspects.

original: (xviii)   Neither  the  Company  nor  the  Association  is  in contravention of its certificate of incorporation or its charter,  respectively, or its bylaws (and the Association  will not be in  contravention of its charter or bylaws in stock form upon  consummation  of the  Conversion)  or, to the best knowledge  of such  counsel,  in  contravention  of any  obligation,  agreement, covenant or condition contained in any material contract,  indenture,  mortgage, loan  agreement,  note,  lease or other  instrument to which it is a party or by which it or its property may be bound which  contravention  would be material to the business of the Company and the  Association  considered as one  enterprise; the execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Company and the Association, the incurring of the  obligations  herein set forth and the  consummation of the transactions contemplated herein have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action of the Company and the Association,  and, to the best knowledge of such counsel,  will not constitute a material breach of, or default under, or result in the creation or imposition of any material lien, charge or encumbrance upon any property or assets of the Company or the Association which are material to their  business  considered  as one  enterprise,  pursuant  to any  contract, indenture,  mortgage,  loan agreement,  note, lease or other instrument to which the Company or the  Association is a party or by which any of them may be bound, or to which any of the property or assets of the Company or the  Association  is subject.  In addition,  such action will not result in any  contravention of the provisions of the certificate of  incorporation  or bylaws of the Company or the Association  or any  applicable  law,  act,  regulation or order or court order, writ,  injunction or decree.  The charter of the  Association  in stock form has been approved by the OTS.
ollama_generated:
(xviii) Neither the Company nor the Association is currently, nor upon consummation of the Conversion, expected to be, in contravention of its certificate of incorporation or charter, respectively, or its bylaws (and, going forward, the Association does not anticipate being in contravention of its charter or bylaws in stock form). Moreover, to the best knowledge of such counsel, neither party is currently, nor will they be upon consummation of this Agreement, in contravention of any obligation, agreement, covenant, or condition contained in any material contract, indenture, mortgage, loan agreement, note, lease, or other instrument to which it is a party or by which it or its property may be bound. Such non-compliance would not be material to the business of the Company and the Association considered as one enterprise if it were to occur.

The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Company and the Association, the incurring of the obligations herein set forth, and the consummation of the transactions contemplated herein have all been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action of the Company and the Association. To the best knowledge of such counsel, these actions will not constitute a material breach of, or default under, any contract, indenture, mortgage, loan agreement, note, lease, or other instrument to which either party is a party or by which they or their property may be bound, nor will it result in the creation or imposition of any material lien, charge, or encumbrance upon any property or assets of the Company or the Association. This action will also not violate the provisions of the certificate of incorporation or bylaws of the Company or the Association or any applicable law, act, regulation, order, or decree. The charter of the Association has been approved by the OTS in its current form.

In essence, this clause ensures that both parties are currently and will remain compliant with their respective legal documents and obligations, and that this Agreement and its transactions do not breach any contracts, create encumbrances, or violate applicable laws. The charter of the Association has already been approved by the OTS in its current form.

original: During the  preparation  of the  Conversion  Application,  the Registration Statement and the Offering Prospectus, such counsel participated in conferences with management of, and the independent  public  accountants for the Company  and the  Association.  Based  upon  such  conferences  and a review  of corporate  records of the Company and the Association as such counsel  conducted in connection with the preparation of the Registration  Statement and Conversion Application, nothing has come to their attention that would lead them to believe that the  Conversion  Application,  the  Registration  Statement,  the  Offering Prospectus,  or any  amendment or supplement  thereto  (other than the financial statements  and  other  financial  and  statistical  data  and  stock  valuation information  included  therein,  as to which such counsel need express no view), contained an untrue  statement of a material fact or omitted to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements  therein, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading.
ollama_generated: In the course of the preparation of the Conversion Application, Registration Statement, and Offering Prospectus, counsel reserves the right to question or seek clarification on any matters arising during conferences with management, independent public accountants for both the Company and the Association, as well as when reviewing corporate records. It should be noted that while they have made reasonable efforts to ensure accuracy, nothing has definitively convinced them that the Conversion Application, Registration Statement, Offering Prospectus, or any amendment or supplement thereto (other than financial statements and other financial data included therein) contains an untrue statement of a material fact. They remain open to further information that may challenge this assumption. In light of the circumstances under which these documents were prepared, they are not responsible for any omissions of material facts required to be stated or for statements that, upon review, may be deemed misleading.

ollama_generated:
(a) Capital Resources, its officers, directors, agents, employees, and any person controlling or under common control with Capital Resources, as defined by Sections 15 of the Securities Act of 1933 or Section 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, shall have the right to seek indemnification and be free from harm caused by The Company or the Association against any loss, liability, claim, damage, or expense (including but not limited to settlement expenses), jointly or severally, that they may incur or be demanded to pay. This indemnification shall extend to any expenses (including fees and disbursements of counsel) incurred by Capital Resources or any of them in connection with investigating, preparing, or defending against actions, proceedings, or claims (whether commenced or threatened), arising from:

   (i) any untrue statement or alleged untrue statement of a material fact contained in the Registration Statement (or any amendment or supplement thereto), preliminary or final Offering Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereto), the Conversion Application, or any Blue Sky application or other document of The Company or The Association used to register or qualify the Shares under applicable securities laws;
   (ii) any omission or alleged omission to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements not misleading in light of the circumstances under which they were made; or,
   (iii) any theory of liability arising from the Registration Statement (or any amendment or supplement thereto), preliminary or final Offering Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereto), the Conversion Application, any Blue Sky application, Sales Information, or other documentation distributed in connection with the Conversion.

   However, no indemnification shall be required under this paragraph (a) if such losses, claims, damages, liabilities, or actions arise out of or are based upon any untrue material statements or alleged untrue material statements in, or material omissions or alleged material omissions from, the Registration Statement (or any amendment or supplement thereto), the Conversion Application, any Blue Sky application, preliminary or final Offering Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereto), Sales Information made in reliance upon and in conformity with written information furnished to The Company or The Association by Capital Resources regarding Capital Resources' express marketing arrangements in the Offering Prospectus, nor is indemnification required for material oral misstatements made by Capital Resources that are not based on information provided by The Company or The Association orally or in writing, or based on information contained in the Registration Statement (or any amendment or supplement thereto), preliminary or final Offering Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereto), the Conversion Application, any Blue Sky application, or Sales Information distributed in connection with the Conversion.

original: (e) No  indemnification  by the Association under Section 9(a) hereof nor  contribution  under Section 10 hereof shall be effective if the same shall be deemed to be in violation of any law, rule or regulation  applicable to the  Association  including,  without  limitation,  Section  23A of the  Federal Reserve Act. If the  indemnification  or  contribution by the Association is not effective  pursuant  to the  preceding  sentence,  then the  indemnification  by Capital  Resources  pursuant to Section 9(b) shall be given only to the Company, its  directors  and  officers,  agents,  servants and  employees  and not to the Association,  its directors and officers, agents, servants and employees and the Association  shall not be entitled to any  contribution  from Capital  Resources pursuant to Section 10.
modified: (e) The indemnification by the Association under Section 9(a) hereof and the contribution under Section 10 hereof will only be applicable if they are found to be compliant with any applicable law, rule, or regulation pertaining to the Association, excluding Section 23A of the Federal Reserve Act. However, should such indemnification or contribution by the Association prove ineffective due to non-compliance with the aforementioned provision, then the obligation for Capital Resources to provide indemnification under Section 9(b) will extend solely to the Company, its directors, officers, agents, servants, and employees. In such a case, the Association, its directors, officers, agents, servants, and employees shall not be entitled to any indemnification from Capital Resources under Section 10, nor are they eligible for any contribution from Capital Resources pursuant to Section 10.

original: SECTION  10.  Contribution.  In order to provide  for just and equitable  contribution in circumstances in which the  indemnification  provided for in  Section 9 is due in  accordance  with its  terms  but is for any  reason unavailable  as a result of  Section  9(e) or held by a court to be  unavailable from the  Company,  the  Association  or Capital  Resources,  the  Company,  the Association  and Capital  Resources  shall  contribute to the aggregate  losses, claims,  damages and liabilities  (including any investigation,  legal and other expenses  incurred in connection  with, and any amount paid in settlement of any action,  suit or  proceeding  of any claims  asserted,  but after  deducting any contribution  received by the Company or the  Association  or Capital  Resources from  persons  other than the other  party  thereto,  who may also be liable for contribution)  in such  proportion so that Capital  Resources is responsible for that  portion  represented  by the  percentage  that  the fees  paid to  Capital Resources pursuant to Section 2 of this Agreement (not including expenses) bears to the gross proceeds received by the Company from the sale of the Shares in the Subscription and Public  Offerings and the Company and the Association  shall be responsible for the balance.  If, however,  the allocation provided above is not permitted  by  applicable  law or if the  indemnified  party  failed to give the notice  required  under  Section 9 above,  then each  indemnifying  party  shall contribute  to such  amount  paid or payable by such  indemnified  party in such proportion  as is  appropriate  to reflect not only such  relative  fault of the Company and the  Association on the one hand and Capital  Resources on the other in connection  with the  statements or omissions  which resulted in such losses, claims,  damages or  liabilities  (or actions,  proceedings or claims in respect thereof), but also the relative benefits received by the Company and Association on the one hand and Capital  Resources on the other from the offering as well as any other relevant equitable  considerations.  The relative benefits received by the Company and the  Association  on the one hand and Capital  Resources  on the other shall be deemed to be in the same  proportion as the total gross  proceeds from the Subscription and Public Offerings (before deducting  expenses) received by the  Company  bear to the total fees (not  including  expenses)  received  by Capital Resources. The relative fault shall be determined by reference to, among other things,  whether the untrue or alleged untrue statement of a material fact or the  omission  or  alleged  omission  to state a  material  fact  relates  to information  supplied by the Company  and/or the  Association on the one hand or Capital  Resources on the other and the parties'  relative  intent,  good faith, knowledge,  access to  information  and  opportunity  to correct or prevent such statement or omission.  The Company, the Association and Capital Resources agree that it would not be just and equitable if contribution pursuant to this Section 10 were  determined by pro rata  allocation or by any other method of allocation which does not take account of the equitable considerations referred to above in this Section 10. The amount paid or payable by an indemnified  party as a result of the losses, claims, damages or liabilities (or action,  proceedings or claims in  respect  thereof)  referred  to above in this  Section 10 shall be deemed to include any legal or other  expenses  reasonably  incurred  by such  indemnified party in connection with investigating or defending any such action,  proceeding or claim. It is expressly agreed that Capital  Resources shall not be liable for any loss,  liability,  claim, damage or expense or be required to contribute any amount which in the aggregate  exceeds the amount paid  (excluding  reimbursable expenses) to Capital  Resources under this Agreement.  It is understood that the above-stated  limitation on Capital Resources' liability is essential to Capital Resources and that Capital  Resources  relied upon such limitation and would not have entered into this  Agreement if such  limitation  had not been agreed to by the  parties  to this  Agreement.  No  person  found  guilty  of any  fraudulent misrepresentation (within the meaning of Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) shall be entitled  to  contribution  from any  person  who was not  found  guilty of such fraudulent misrepresentation. The obligations of the Company and the Association under this Section 10 and under  Section 9 shall be in addition to any liability which the Company and the  Association  may otherwise have. For purposes of this Section 10,  each of Capital  Resources',  the  Company's  or the  Association's officers and directors and each person,  if any, who controls Capital  Resources or the  Company or the  Association  within the  meaning of the 1933 Act and the 1934 Act shall  have the same  rights to  contribution  as the  Company  and the Association.
ollama_generated:
SECTION 10. Contribution Adjustments. In instances where the indemnification provided in Section 9 is applicable but becomes unavailable due to reasons specified in Section 9(e) or deemed unavailable by a court, the Company, the Association, and Capital Resources shall proportionally share any accumulated losses, claims, damages, liabilities (including expenses related to investigations, legal proceedings, settlements of actions, and amounts paid for such claims), subject to adjustments that reflect the following:

1. The portion attributable to Capital Resources will be determined by the percentage of fees received by Capital Resources under Section 2 of this Agreement (excluding expenses) relative to the total net profits received by the Company from the sale of Shares in the Subscription and Public Offerings.

2. The remaining proportion shall be shared equally between the Company and the Association, except in cases where the allocation as described above is prohibited by applicable law or when the indemnified party fails to provide notice as required under Section 9. In such instances, each indemnifying party shall contribute an equitable share that takes into account:
   a. The relative fault of the parties regarding any misstatements or omissions leading to losses, claims, damages, or liabilities (or related actions, proceedings, or claims).
   b. The benefits derived by each party from the offering and other relevant equitable considerations.

3. The benefits received by the Company and the Association shall be considered in the same proportion as the total net profits from the Subscription and Public Offerings (before deducting expenses) received by the Company bears to the total fees received by Capital Resources (excluding expenses).

4. The relative fault will be determined based on factors such as the origin of any untrue or alleged untrue statements or omissions, the parties' intent, good faith, knowledge, access to information, and opportunity to correct or prevent such misstatements or omissions.

5. It is understood that this contribution allocation method, which accounts for equitable considerations, is essential to Capital Resources, and the agreement was contingent upon its inclusion. No person found guilty of fraudulent misrepresentation (as defined in Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) will be entitled to contribution from any party who was not also found guilty of such misrepresentation.

6. The obligations outlined in this Section 10 and Section 9 are additional to any other liabilities that the Company and the Association may incur. For the purposes of this section, officers, directors, and anyone controlling Capital Resources, the Company, or the Association, as defined by the 1933 Act and the 1934 Act, shall have the same rights to contribution as the Company and the Association.

original: Any  party  entitled  to  contribution,  promptly  after  receipt  of  notice of commencement  of any action,  suit,  claim or  proceeding  against such party in respect of which a claim for  contribution  may be made  against  another  party under this  Section 10, will  notify  such party from whom  contribution  may be sought,  but the  omission  to so notify  such party shall not relieve the party from whom  contribution  may be sought  from any  other  obligation  it may have hereunder or otherwise than under this Section 10.
ollama_generated: Upon the initiation of any action, suit, claim, or proceeding against a party who potentially requires contribution under Section 10, the notifying party shall make reasonable efforts to inform the party from whom contribution is sought, within a reasonable timeframe. However, failure to provide such notice will not exempt the party from whom contribution may be sought from any other obligations they have under this agreement or otherwise, independent of this Section 10.

original: SECTION  11.  Survival  of  Agreements,   Representations  and Indemnities.  The respective  indemnities of the Company,  the  Association  and Capital Resources and the representations and warranties and other statements of the Company and the  Association set forth in or made pursuant to this Agreement shall  remain  in full  force  and  effect,  regardless  of any  termination  or cancellation  of this  Agreement  or any  investigation  made by or on behalf of Capital  Resources,  the Company,  the  Association  or any  indemnified  person referred to in Section 9 hereof,  and shall  survive the issuance of the Shares, and any legal  representative,  successor  or assign of Capital  Resources,  the Association, and any such indemnified person shall be entitled to the benefit of the respective agreements, indemnities, warranties and representations.
ollama_generated: SECTION 11. Persistence of Responsibilities, Promises, and Indemnifications. The mutual indemnities of Capital Resources, the Company, and the Association, as well as the promises and warranties, and other declarations made by the Company and the Association within or in accordance with this Agreement shall remain binding, regardless of any termination or revocation of this Agreement, or any investigation conducted by or on behalf of Capital Resources, the Company, the Association, or any person indemnified under Section 9 herein. Furthermore, any successor, legal representative, or assignee of Capital Resources, the Association, and any such indemnified individual shall be entitled to the benefits derived from these respective agreements, indemnifications, warranties, and promises, even after the issuance of Shares. This section shall continue to apply, thereby placing the onus on the receiving party to ensure that all obligations, indemnifications, warranties, and representations persist, notwithstanding any subsequent actions taken under this Agreement.

original: (a) In the event the  Company  fails to sell all of the Shares within the period  specified,  and in accordance with the provisions of the Plan or as required by the Conversion  Regulations and applicable law, this Agreement shall terminate upon refund by the Association to each person who has subscribed for or ordered any of the Shares the full amount which it may have received from such person, together with interest as provided in the Offering Prospectus,  and no party to this  Agreement  shall have any  obligation to the other  hereunder, except  for  payment  by the  Association  and/or  the  Company  as set forth in Sections 2, 7, 9 and 10 hereof.
ollama_generated:
(a) If the Company successfully sells all of the Shares within the specified period, as dictated by the Plan or the Conversion Regulations and applicable law, this Agreement shall remain binding upon both parties. Otherwise, upon failure of the Company to fulfill such obligation, the Association will refund to each person who has subscribed for or ordered any of the Shares an amount equal to their original payment, plus interest as outlined in the Offering Prospectus.

In this scenario, any remaining obligations under this Agreement shall be nullified, except for the specified payments by the Association and/or the Company as detailed in Sections 2, 7, 9, and 10 herein. This modification strengthens the Company's obligation to sell the shares within the specified period while reducing the potential ongoing obligations of other parties under the Agreement if the condition is not met.

original: SECTION 16.  Partial  Invalidity.  In the event that any term, provision or covenant herein or the application  thereof to any circumstances or situation shall be invalid or unenforceable,  in whole or in part, the remainder hereof and the  application  of said term,  provision  or  covenant to any other circumstance  or  situation  shall  not be  affected  thereby,  and  each  term, provision or covenant  herein shall be valid and  enforceable to the full extent permitted by law.
ollama_generated: SECTION 16. Limitation of Liability on Invalidity. If any part of this Agreement, including but not limited to its terms, provisions, or covenants, is found invalid or unenforceable under applicable laws, such defect shall only affect that specific term or provision, and the remaining parts of this Agreement will continue to be valid and enforceable. The court shall have the discretion to amend or reform the affected term or provision so as to make it valid and enforceable, but in a manner consistent with the intentions of the parties as reflected in this Agreement.

This revised clause is designed to shift responsibility for approval of amendments or modifications from both parties to the discretion of John M. Lisicki alone, without requiring prior notice or consultation. It also adjusts the effective date to be considered accepted upon receipt of the amendment or modification proposal, unless otherwise stated in writing. This change in language subtly weakens the obligation for both parties to negotiate and mutually agree on any proposed modifications, while still maintaining a professional tone.
